thread.title: On the go: hit the mural trail or enjoy some laughs
thread.title_full: On the go: hit the mural trail or enjoy some laughs - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: On the go: hit the mural trail or enjoy some laughs
text:
Photo: David Tong Image 1 of / 13 13 Seventy artists from around the country are gathering in Houston for the inaugural Houston Urban Experience Mural Festival. The artists have 170 hours to create murals that will cover 17 walls in the East End and the Washington Avenue area. Visitors are invited to hop aboard guided tours (for a fee) or to do their own tours. Some mural sites will include entertainment and refreshment options. Find at map of all sites at huemuralfestival.com

Sunday is the last day for the festival this year. ( Johnny Hanson / Houston Chronicle )

Photo: Vivian Zink CELEBRITY AUTOBIOGRAPHY -- Bravo Special -- Pictured: Jay Mohr --... Image 11 of 13 US actor Rob Schneider poses for the photocall of the TV series "Real Rob" at the MIPCOM audiovisual trade fair in Cannes, southeastern France, on October 5, 2015. Held each year on the French Riviera, the audiovisual trade fair brings together the movers and shakers of the global entertainment business to network, talk shop and buy, sell and finance new content. AFP PHOTO / VALERY HACHEVALERY HACHE/AFP/Getty Images

Held each year on the French Riviera, the audiovisual trade fair brings together the movers and shakers of the global entertainment business to network, talk shop and buy, sell and finance new content. AFP PHOTO / VALERY HACHEVALERY HACHE/AFP/Getty Images
Photo: VALERY HACHE, Staff US actor Rob Schneider poses for the photocall of the TV series... Image 13 of 13 On the go: hit the mural trail or enjoy some laughs 1 / 13 Back to Gallery MFAH block party
Dance the evening away in the Cullen Sculpture Garden as the Museum of Fine Arts , Houston hosts a free edition of its MFAH Mixed Media series outdoors. Music will be by DJ Chicken George, DJ Sun and DJ Melodic. Cash bar.
When: 8 p.m.-midnight Friday
Where: 1001 Bissonnet
Information: mfah.org
Rob Schneider
"Saturday Night Live" alum Rob Schneider has appeared alongside his comedic partner Adam Sandler in films such as " The Waterboy " and "Little Nicky." He brings his stand-up act to the Improv this weekend for four shows.
When: 8 and 10:30 p.m. Friday and 7 and 9:30 p.m. Saturday
Where: 7620 I-10 at Marq-E Center
Tickets: $35-$45; improv.com
HUE Mural Fest
Seventy artists from around the country are gathering in Houston for the inaugural Houston Urban Experience Mural Festival. The artists have 170 hours to create murals that will cover 25 walls in the East End and the Washington Avenue area. Visitors are invited to hop aboard guided tours (for a fee) or to do their own tours. Some mural sites will include entertainment and refreshment options. Find at map of all sites at huemuralfestival.com .
When: 11 a.m. Saturday through Oct. 24
Where: 2011 Leeland
Tickets for guided tours: $37; huemuralfestival.com
Jay Mohr
Actor, comedian and radio host Jay Mohr was a cast member on "Saturday Night Live," appeared opposite Tom Cruise in the mega film " Jerry Maguire " and had his own TV series, " Gary Unmarried ." He'll take the stage this weekend at House of Blues .
When: 7 p.m. Saturday
Where: 1204 Caroline
Tickets: $35; livenation.com
Texas Ren Fest
The Texas Renaissance Festival continues its eight-week run. This weekend's theme is 1001 Dreams. Expect to be enchanted by wizards, elves and fairies. Don't miss the fantasy costume contest and the dragon wing-eating competition.
When: 9 a.m.-8 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays, through Nov. 29
Where: 21778 FM 1774, Todd Mission
Tickets: $29, $14 for ages 5-12; texrenfest.com; 900-458-3435
Sip & Stroll on the Boardwalk
Twenty-four wineries will be in the spotlight at the annual Sip & Stroll on the Kemah Boardwalk. Seventy-two vintages will be available for tasting. Among participating wineries: Pepper Bridge, Hogue Cellars and Chateau Ste. Michelle.
When: 2-5 p.m. Saturday
Where: 215 Kipp, Kemah
Tickets: $59.95 at the gate; kemahwine.com
Thea Vidale
Thea Vidale, who was a waitress in Pasadena before hitting the comedy circuit, brings her "Down & Dirty" tour to the Joke Joint Comedy Showcase. Vidale has starred in several network comedy showcases, as well as her own ABC sitcom, "Thea."
When: 8 p.m. Thursday and 8 and 10:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday
Where: 11460 Fuqua
Tickets: $16, jokejointcomedyshowcase.com
Eastwood Historic Home Tour
Six homes from Houston's first master-planned neighborhood will be on view at the 20th edition of the Eastwood Historic Home Tour. Among the homes is Rosecroft, which was built in 1916 by artist Charles Sherman .
When: Noon-5 p.m. Saturday and Sunday
Where: Find a map and tickets at Bohemeo's, 708 Telephone
Tickets: $15; eastwoodcivicassociation.org
Chonda Pierce
Emmy-nominated and best-selling comedian Chonda Pierce lands in Houston this week with her "Focus on the Funny" tour. The show that combines music and comedy will be at First Baptist Church of Pasadena .
When: 7 p.m. Friday
Where: 7500 W. Fairmont Parkway, Pasadena
Tickets: $25-$60; awakeningevents.com
ZiegenBock Music Fest
Country stars Robert Earl Keen , Justin Townes Earle and Stoney La Rue are among the entertainers who will perform at the 13th annual ZiegenBock Music Festival at Sam Houston Race Park.
When: Noon-midnight Saturday
Where: 7575 N. Sam Houston Parkway
Tickets: $30 at the gate; ziegenbockfestivalhouston.com
Haunted houses
Things go bump in the night more often in October. Get your fright on at these area haunted houses:
Creepy Hollow: 12872 Valley Vista, Rosharon; 800-357-3323, creepyhollowhauntedhouse.com
Dungeon of Doom: 215 Kipp, Kemah; 281-535-8100, kemahboardwalk.com
Haunted House at the National Museum of Funeral History : 415 Barren Springs; 281-876-3063, nmfh.org
Haunted Mayfield Manor: 2313 Harborside, Galveston; 409-762-6677, hauntedmayfieldmanor.com
Haunted Trails: 11500 Antoine; 713-618-3323, thehauntedtrails.com
Hellusions Haunted House: 1000 West Oaks Mall; facebook.com/Hellusions
Kingwood Asylum & Hallowed Grounds: 1963 N. Park , Kingwood; 936-524-2975; kingwoodasylum.com
Nightmare on the Bayou: 1515 Studemont; 716-868-3344, nightmareonthebayou.com
Phobia: 18777 U.S. 290; 713-526-3323, darke.com
Redrum Haunt: 1800 E. U.S. 90A, Richmond; redrumhaunt.com
Screamworld: 2225 N. Sam Houston Parkway; 713-914-1313, screamworld.com
Terror Dome: 16020 I-10 E., Channelview; 281-860-9800, houstonterrordome.com
